poem:
### Shadows of Discourse

Farage, shifting sands  
of declarations—  
retreats under a canopy  
of whispered doubt.  
No 10, a vessel adrift,  
denies entanglements,  
while Sue's exit lingers  
like autumn leaves—  
unsettled, yet swept  
by winds of questions.  
In the murmur, truth  
dances reluctantly.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "No 10 denies Starmer has a problem working with women following Sue Gray’s exit – UK politics live 1.46pm BST Farage backtracks on claim he is not holding in-person constituency surgeries due to security advice from Commons Nigel Farage, the Reform UK leader, has rowed back on claims he was advised by Commons authorities not to hold in-person constituency surgeries on security grounds. As PA Media reports, last month Farage claimed he would hold surgeries". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: No 10 denies Starmer has a problem working with women following Sue Gray’s exit – UK politics live 1.46pm BST Farage backtracks on claim he is not holding in-person constituency surgeries due to security advice from Commons Nigel Farage, the Reform UK leader, has rowed back on claims he was advised by Commons authorities not to hold in-person constituency surgeries on security grounds. As PA Media reports, last month Farage claimed he would hold surgeries
